Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush 1 relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off relay after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 65535 => 0,01 second - 655,35 seconds. Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 10mseconds. Default value 0

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure

Item.label: Flush 1relay module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush 1relay module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0%- 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 3

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)

Value.label: Input 2 contact type
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Value.label: Input 3 contact type
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush 1 relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. Default value 0.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Item.label: Flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1 second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through. 1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds. Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key pressed
Value.Help: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1. 1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds. Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).

Value.label: IN1 Alarm Cancellation Delay
Value.Help: Input I alarm cancellation delay. Additional delay after an alarm from input IN1 has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the input no. 1 alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

Value.label: Status change signalled by LED
Value.Help: Status change signalled by LED. Default setting: LED turned On

Value.label: Type of input no. 1
Value.Help: Type of input no. 1, what the input 1 will report if no contact is made

Value.label: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 1
Value.Help: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 1, activated via input IN1. The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

Value.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
Value.Help: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes "switch on" / "open" command to devices from association group no. 1. In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Possible parameter settings: (1 - 99) and 255. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device when using the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

Value.label: Deactivate transmission of frame cancelling alarm
Value.Help: Deactivating transmission of the frame cancelling the alarm or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic). It allows for disabling the deactivation function or the alarm cancellation function for devices associated with the appropriate input of the Fibaro Sensor. NOTE: Information concerning alarm violation or activation commands for devices from association groups are always sent.

Value.label: Interval between successive readings of temperature sensors
Value.Help: Interval between successive readings of temperature from all sensors connected to the device in seconds. Note: taking temperature readings from the sensor does not result in sending a temperature condition report to the central hub.

Value.label: Interval between forcing to send report concerning the temperature conditions
Value.Help: Interval between forcing to send report concerning the temperature conditions. The forced report is sent immediately after the next reading of temperature from the sensor, irrespective of the settings of parameter no. 12. Value 0 = Deactivates the function. Note: Frequent sending of temperature condition reports is reasonable when the sensor is located somewhere where can occure rapid changes of ambient temperature. In other cases it is recommended to leave the parameter set to the default value.

Value.label: Insensitiveness to temperature changes
Value.Help: Insensitiveness to temperature changes. This is the maximum acceptable difference between the last reported temperature and the current temperature taken from the sensor. If the temperatures differ by the set value or more, then a report with the current temperature value is sent to the device assigned to association group no. 3. Intervals between taking readings from sensors are specified by parameter no. 10. Possible parameter settings:0 - 255 [0oC to 16oC] [0 oF - 28.8oF] In order to set the appropriate value of the parameter, the following formula should be used: x = delta T x 16 - for Celsius x = delta T x 80 / 9 - for Fahrenheit x - parameter value delta T - maximum acceptable temperature gradient in Celsius or Fahrenheit If the value is set to 0, then information about the temperature will be sent every time, immediately once the readings have been taken from the sensor.

Value.label: Transmitting the alarm or control frame broadcast mode
Value.Help: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in "broadcast" mode (i.e. to all devices within range), information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network. NOTE: If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of information in singlecast mode to devices assigned to the association group of this channel is deactivated.

Item.label: IN1 broadcast mode active, Sensor 2 broadcast mode inactive
IN1 broadcast mode inactive, Sensor 2 broadcast mode active
INI and IN2 broadcast mode active

Value.label: Scene activation
Value.Help: Enable/Disable scene functionality. The device offers the possibility of sending commands compatible with Command class scene activation. Information is sent to devices assigned to association group no. 3.

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Activate/Deactive ALL ON/OFF

Item.label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Value.label: Associations command class choice
Value.Help: Choose which command classes are sent to associated devices.

Value.label: Outputs state change mode
Value.Help: Choose the behaviour of transitions between different levels.

Item.label: MODE 1 - Constant Speed (speed is defined by parameters 9 and 10)
MODE 2 - Constant Time (RGB/RBGW only. Time is defined by parameter 11)

Value.label: Dimming step value (for MODE 1)
Value.Help: Size of the step for each change in level during the transition.

Value.label: Time between dimming steps (for MODE 1)
Value.Help: Time between each step in a transition between levels. Setting this to zero means an instantaneous change.

Value.label: Time to complete the entire transition (for MODE 2)
Value.Help: 0 - immediate change; 1->63: 20ms->126ms (value*20ms); 65->127: 1s->63s (value-64)*1s; 129->191: 10s->630s (value-128)*10s; 193->255: 1min->63min (value-192)*1min. Default setting: 67 (3s)

Value.label: Maximum dimmer level
Value.Help: Maximum brightness level for the dimmer

Value.label: Minimum dimmer level
Value.Help: Minimum brightness level for the dimmer

Value.label: Inputs / Outputs configuration
Value.Help: This is too complex to describe here, since this value is built up from 4-bits for each of the 4 channels. Refer to the table in the product manual. Default value is 4369 (1111 in hex).

Value.label: Option double click
Value.Help: Option double click (lighting set at 100%). 0 - Double click disabled, 1 - Double click enabled. Default setting 1

Value.label: Saving state before power faillure
Value.Help: Saving state before power faillure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Alarm
Value.Help: Alarm of any type (general alarm, water flooding alarm, smoke alarm: CO, CO2, temperature alarm). Default setting 0 (Inactive)

Item.label: INACTIVE - no response to alarm frames
ALARM ON - the device turns on once alarm is detected (all channels set to 99%)
ALARM OFF - the device turns off once alarm is detected (all channels set to 0%)
ALARM PROGRAM - alarm sequence turns on (program selected in parameter 38)

Value.label: Alarm sequence program
Value.Help: Program number selected from the 10 available.

Value.label: Active PROGRAM alarm time
Value.Help: In ALARM PROGRAM mode (see parameter 30), this defines the time in seconds the program lasts (1s->65534s)

Value.label: Command class reporting Outputs status change
Value.Help: Specify which command class is used to report output status changes

Item.label: Reporting as a result of inputs and controllers actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
Reporting as a result inputs actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
Reporting as a result inputs actions (COLOUR_CONTROL)

Value.label: Reporting 0-10v analog inputs change threshold
Value.Help: Parameter defines a value by which input voltage must change in order to be reported to the main controller. New value is calculated based on last reported value: Default setting: 5 (0.5V). Range: 1->100 - (0.1V->10V).

Value.label: Power load reporting frequency
Value.Help: Sent if last reported value differs from the current value. Reports will also be sent in case of polling. Default setting: 30 (30s). Range: 1->65534 (1s->65534s) - interval between reports. Zero means reports are only sent in the case of polling, or at turning OFF the device

Value.label: Reporting changes in energy consumed by controlled devices
Value.Help: Interval between energy consumption reports (in kWh). New reported energy consumption value is calculated based on last reported value. 1->254 (0.01kWh->2.54kWh). Zero means changes in consumed energy will not be reported, except in case of polling.

Value.label: Response to BRIGHTNESS set to 0%
Value.Help: Set whether to remember the previous RGB mix after the brightness has fallen to zero (black)

Item.label: Illumination colour set to white (all channels controlled together)

Value.label: Starting predefined program
Value.Help: First predefined program to use when device is set to work in RGB/RGBW mode (parameter 14)

Value.label: Triple Click Action
Value.Help: Behaviour when an input is triple-clicked

Item.label: NODE INFO control frame is sent

Value.label: No communication light
Value.Help: After how many minutes the GreenWave device should start flashing if the controller didn't communicate with this device

Value.label: Room color
Value.Help: The room color (Corner wheel color) on the GreenWave device
